newsitem.title: POLAND: MERRILL LOWERS POLIFARBC 97 PROFIT OUTLOOK.
newsitem.headline: MERRILL LOWERS POLIFARBC 97 PROFIT OUTLOOK.

text.p: Merrill Lynch in London has lowered its 1997 profit forecast for Polish paintmaker Polifarb Cieszyn SA by 10 percent because of the current competitive market environment, Merrill said in a report dated December 18.

"Following a conversation with management we have lowered our 1997 earnings forecast for (Polifarb Cieszyn) by 10 percent to reflect the current competitive market environment," said the report which maintained the firm's accumulate rating.
Merrill did not give its forecasted profits for the firm but changed its 1997 earnings-per-share (EPS) forecast to 1.23 zlotys from the 1.37 zlotys earlier in the month.
The company currently has 19,125,000 shares outstanding.
Merrill said the prediction did not reflect the company's planned merger later in 1997 with Polifarb Wroclaw , which it saw as a good sign.
"For current shareholders the merger should enhance value by eliminating inter-company competition, boosting purchasing power and focusing management on cost cutting," it said.
Merrill said the merger should lead to EPS growth starting in 1998 as product lines were rationalised and manufacturing assets optimised.
Polifarb Cieszyn, which was at 14.5 zlotys at the time of the report, closed at 18 zlotys on Thursday.
